title: 20-member Bangladesh delegation in Kolkata to attend Victory Day celebrations
body: A 20-member delegation from Bangladesh is visiting Kolkata, in India's West Bengal, to attend the Victory Day celebrations on December 16, at the invitation of the Indian Army. The delegation includes Brig Gen Md Lutfor Rahman, director at the Education Directorate of the General Staff branch of the Army Headquarters and Major Sher-E-Shahbaz of the Bangladesh Military Academy, eight freedom fighters, and members of their families. Upon arriving in Kolkata airport, officials of the Indian Army's Eastern Command formally received the delegation yesterday. Today, the delegation participated in a programme called the 'Military Tattu' at the Mangal Pandey Military Training Centre in Barrackpore of West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district. The delegation was scheduled to participate in the Victory Festival at Kolkata's Fort William today as part of the main Victory Day celebration. Additionally, they will attend various memorial services, including offering tributes at the Victory Memorial. The freedom fighters in the delegation include Habibul Alam, Bir Protik; Maj (retd) Alik Kumar Gupta, Bir Protik; Maj (retd) Quamrul Abedin; Maj (retd) Manish Dewan; Maj (retd) Muhammad Abdul Hakim; Maj (retd) Hafizur Rahman; Brig Gen (retd) Md Shamsul Huda and Abdullah Hil Shafi, member of the Central Command Council of Bangladesh Muktijoddha Sangsad.
